sen.j: 足尾暴動事件（あしおぼうどうじけん）は、1907年2月4日から2月7日まで、足尾銅山の坑夫らが、鉱山施設などを破壊、放火した事件。
sen.e: Ashio Riot was an event from February 4, 1907 to February 7, that mine workers in Ashio Copper Mine destroyed the facilities in the mine and set fire.
The "Ashio Riot" was an event occurred from February 4, 1907 to February 7, that mine workers in Ashio Copper Mine destroyed and set fire to the facilities in the mine.
The "Ashio Riot" was an event occurred from February 4, 1907 to February 7, that mine workers in Ashio Copper Mine destroyed and set fire to the facilities in the mine.

sen.j: 足尾銅山暴動事件、あしおどうざんぼうどうじけん、とも。
sen.e: It is also called Ashio Copper Mine Riot.
It is also called the Ashio Copper Mine Riot.
sen.cmt: Ashio を the Ashio に修正しました。
sen.e: It is also called the Ashio Copper Mine Riot.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 1903年、夕張からやってきた永岡鶴蔵は、夕張にある大日本労働至誠会と同じような鉱山労働者の組織を足尾でも結成しようと考えたが、この時代にはうまくいかなかった。
sen.e: In 1903, Tsuruzo NAGAOKA who came from Yubari thought of establishing an organization for mine workers in Ashio, like Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai in Yubari, but it didn't work out at that time.
In 1903, Tsuruzo NAGAOKA who came from Yubari thought of establishing an organization for mine workers in Ashio, like Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai in Yubari, but it didn't work out at that time.
In 1903, Tsuruzo NAGAOKA who came from Yubari thought of establishing an organization for mine workers in Ashio, like Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai in Yubari, but it didn't work out at that time.

sen.j: その後、夕張炭鉱から足尾銅山にやってきた南助松は、永岡と協力し、1906年12月5日、大日本労働至誠会足尾支部を結成。
sen.e: Later on, Sukematsu MINAMI who came to Ashio Copper Mine from Yubari Cole Mine cooperated with NAGAOKA, and on December 5, 1906, and they set up Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai, Ashio branch.
Later on, Sukematsu MINAMI who came to Ashio Copper Mine from Yubari Cole Mine cooperated with Nagaoka, and they set up Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai, Ashio branch on December 5, 1906.
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Later on, Sukematsu MINAMI who came to Ashio Copper Mine from Yubari Cole Mine cooperated with Nagaoka, and they set up Dainihon Rodo Shiseikai, Ashio branch on December 5, 1906.

sen.j: 12月と1月に演説会を開いた。
sen.e: They held speech meetings on December and January.
They held speech meetings in December and January.
sen.cmt: on を in に修正しました。
sen.e: They held speech meetings in December and January.

sen.j: 当時、足尾銅山は、足尾鉱毒事件で命令された鉱毒防止費用などが負担となり、鉱山労働者の賃金は安く、しかも、労働条件は過酷なもので、労働者の不満は高まっていた。
sen.e: At that time in Ashio Copper Mine, wages for mine workers were low, due to the cost for prevention of mineral pollution which was ordered in Ashio Mineral Pollution Incident, and in addition, the work condition was so hard that workers complaints had mounted.

At that time in the Ashio Copper Mine, mine workers' complaints were mounting because of their low wages due to the cost for prevention of mineral pollution which was ordered in Ashio Mineral Pollution Incident and their poor working conditions.

At that time in the Ashio Copper Mine, mine workers' complaints were mounting because of their low wages due to the cost for prevention of mineral pollution which was ordered in Ashio Mineral Pollution Incident and their poor working conditions.

sen.j: 2月4日午前、通洞抗内で見張り所が破壊され、ダイナマイトが投げ込まれた。
sen.e: In the morning of February 4, a watch-house in Tsudo mine was destroyed, and dynamites were thrown in.
In the morning of February 4, a watch-house in Tsudo mine was destroyed, and dynamites were thrown in.
In the morning of February 4, a watch-house in Tsudo mine was destroyed, and dynamites were thrown in.

sen.j: 騒ぎを聞いて坑口にやってきた南と永岡鶴蔵は、賃上げや労働条件の改善は、自分らが責任をもって鉱山側と交渉するからと坑夫らを説得。
sen.e: MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA who heard about the riot came to the mine mouth and persuaded mine workers that they would responsibly negotiate with the operator of the mine to improve the wages and the working conditions.

Hearing of the riot, Minami and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA came to the mine mouth and persuaded mine workers that they would responsibly negotiate with the operator of the mine to improve the wages and their working conditions.

Hearing of the riot, Minami and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA came to the mine mouth and persuaded mine workers that they would responsibly negotiate with the operator of the mine to improve the wages and their working conditions.

sen.j: 事態はいったんおさまった。
sen.e: The situation was once settled.
The situation was once settled.
The situation was once settled.

sen.j: この日、通洞はそれ以降の操業を停止した。
sen.e: On this day, subsequent operations of Tsudo had stopped.
On this day, subsequent operations of Tsudo had stopped.
On this day, subsequent operations of Tsudo had stopped.

sen.j: しかし、騒ぎは翌2月5日、本山坑らに飛び火。
sen.e: But the next day on February 5, the riot spilt over to Honzan mine.
But the next day, on February 5, the riot spilt over to Honzan mine.
sen.cmt: day on を day, on に修正しました。
sen.e: But the next day, on February 5, the riot spilt over to Honzan mine.

sen.j: 同じようにダイナマイトで見張り所が爆破された。
sen.e: Likewise, a watch-house was blown up with dynamites.
Likewise, a watch-house was blown up with dynamites.
Likewise, a watch-house was blown up with dynamites.

sen.j: 南らはこの日も本山に出向き、労働者を説得した。
sen.e: MINAMI and others went to Honzan on that day and persuaded the workers.
Again, Minami and others went to Honzan on that day and persuaded the workers.
sen.cmt: MINAMI を Minami に修正しました。文頭に Again を追記しました。
sen.e: Again, Minami and others went to Honzan on that day and persuaded the workers.

sen.j: しかし、事態はおさまらず、翌2月6日は朝から鉱山事務所が襲撃され、所長の南廷三は暴行された。
sen.e: But the situation didn't settle, and the next day, on February 6, the mine office was attacked in the morning and the director, Teizo MINAMI was assaulted.
But the situation didn't settle, and the next day, on February 6, the mine office was attacked in the morning and the director, Teizo MINAMI was assaulted.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: But the situation didn't settle, and the next day, on February 6, the mine office was attacked in the morning and the director, Teizo MINAMI was assaulted.

sen.j: しかし、殺すなという声が上がり、南廷三はそのまま鉱山病院に担ぎ込まれ、2週間後には業務に復帰したという。
sen.e: But a voice saying, don't kill, was raised, and Teizo MINAMI was sent to the Mine Hospital directly, and he returned to his work two weeks later.
But a voice saying, don't kill, was raised, and Teizo MINAMI was sent to the Mine Hospital directly, and he returned to his work two weeks later.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: But a voice saying, don't kill, was raised, and Teizo MINAMI was sent to the Mine Hospital directly, and he returned to his work two weeks later.

sen.j: さらにこの日午前10時過ぎ、南助松と永岡鶴蔵が、教唆扇動の疑いで逮捕され、宇都宮市に護送されると、逆に暴動を制止する者がいなくなり、収拾のつかない大規模な暴動に発展した。
sen.e: Furthermore, shortly after ten o'clock in the morning of that day, Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were arrested for solicitation and incitement and escorted to Utsunomiya City, so there was nobody to stop the riot, and this escalated the riot beyond control.

Furthermore, shortly after ten o'clock in the morning of that day, Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were arrested for solicitation and incitement and escorted to Utsunomiya City, so there was nobody to stop the riot, and this escalated the riot beyond control.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, shortly after ten o'clock in the morning of that day, Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were arrested for solicitation and incitement and escorted to Utsunomiya City, so there was nobody to stop the riot, and this escalated the riot beyond control.

sen.j: 労働者らは事務所を襲い、食料や酒を奪って飲み食いしし、午後には施設に放火したが、現金には手をつけるなという指令がどこからか出ていたともいう。
sen.e: Workers attacked offices, ate and drank what they robbed, and in the afternoon they set fire to the facilities, but it was said that someone ordered to get their hands off money.
Workers attacked offices, ate and drank what they robbed, and in the afternoon they set fire to the facilities, but it was said that someone ordered to get their hands off money.
Workers attacked offices, ate and drank what they robbed, and in the afternoon they set fire to the facilities, but it was said that someone ordered to get their hands off money.

sen.j: 同日、事態を抑えきれなくなった警察側は、11時過ぎに栃木県知事に出兵要請するよう打電。
sen.e: On the same day, shortly after eleven o'clock, the police which couldn't control the situation sent a telegram asking governor of Tochigi Prefecture for a dispatch of troops.
On the same day, shortly after eleven o'clock, the police which couldn't control the situation any more sent a telegram asking governor of Tochigi Prefecture for a dispatch of troops.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを半角に修正しました。control に any more を追記しました。
sen.e: On the same day, shortly after eleven o'clock, the police which couldn't control the situation any more sent a telegram asking governor of Tochigi Prefecture for a dispatch of troops.

sen.j: 栃木県知事中山巳代蔵は、午後1時過ぎ軍隊の出動を要請。
sen.e: Governor of Tochigi prefecture, Miyozo NAKAYAMA requested the dispatch of troops shortly after one o'clock in the afternoon.
The governor of Tochigi Prefecture, Miyozo NAKAYAMA requested the dispatch of troops shortly after one o'clock in the afternoon.
sen.cmt: Governor を The governor に修正しました。prefecture を Prefecture に修正しました。アポストロフィを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: The governor of Tochigi Prefecture, Miyozo NAKAYAMA requested the dispatch of troops shortly after one o'clock in the afternoon.

sen.j: 高崎市から3個中隊が足尾に派遣されたが、到着は翌2月7日午後であった。
sen.e: Three troops were sent to Ashio from Takasaki City, but their arrival was in the afternoon of the next day, February 7.
Three troops were sent to Ashio from Takasaki City, but their arrival was in the afternoon of the next day, February 7.
Three troops were sent to Ashio from Takasaki City, but their arrival was in the afternoon of the next day, February 7.

sen.j: 7日、足尾銅山は全山で操業を停止した。
sen.e: On 7, Ashio Copper Mine stopped operations in every mountains.
On 7, Ashio Copper Mine stopped operations in every mountains.
On 7, Ashio Copper Mine stopped operations in every mountains.

sen.j: この日はこれといった騒ぎは起こらず、軍隊到着とともに、関係者が逮捕された。
sen.e: On this day, there was no particular troubles had happened, and as the troops arrived, the persons concerned were arrested.
On this day, there was no particular troubles happened, and as the troops arrived, the persons concerned were arrested.
sen.cmt: had happened を happened に修正しました。
sen.e: On this day, there was no particular troubles happened, and as the troops arrived, the persons concerned were arrested.

sen.j: 検挙者数は629名。
sen.e: The number of arrested persons was 629.
The number of arrested persons was 629.
The number of arrested persons was 629.

sen.j: うち182名が起訴された。
sen.e: And 182 of them were charged.
And 182 of them were charged.
And 182 of them were charged.

sen.j: この日に騒ぎがなかった理由については、前日騒いだせいで、労働者らが疲れ切っていたためという説と、軍隊が来るという情報が伝わったためという説がある。
sen.e: It is said that the reason why there was no troubles occurred on that day was because the workers were too tired or because they heard that the troops would come.
It is said that the reason why there was no troubles occurred on that day was because the workers were too tired or because they heard that the troops would come.
It is said that the reason why there was no troubles occurred on that day was because the workers were too tired or because they heard that the troops would come.

sen.j: なお、3つある主な坑口（本山、小滝、通洞）のうち、小滝坑口だけは暴動に参加しなかった。
sen.e: There were three main mine mouths (Honzan, Kotaki, and Tsudo), and only Kotaki didn't participate the riot.
There were three main mine mouths (Honzan, Kotaki, and Tsudo), and only Kotaki didn't participate in the riot.
sen.cmt: didn’t participate を didn't participate in に修正しました。
sen.e: There were three main mine mouths (Honzan, Kotaki, and Tsudo), and only Kotaki did not participate in the riot.
sen.cmt: didn't をdid notとしました。

sen.j: 7日、武藤金吉は衆議院で、暴動に関する質問を行った。
sen.e: On 7, Kinkichi MUTO asked questions about the riot at the House of Representatives.
On 7, Kinkichi MUTO asked questions about the riot at the House of Representatives.
On 7, Kinkichi MUTO asked questions about the riot at the House of Representatives.

sen.j: 暴動の損害は27万円とされている。
sen.e: The damage of the riot was estimated to 270 thousand yen.
The damage of the riot was estimated to 270 thousand yen.
The damage of the riot was estimated to 270 thousand yen.

sen.j: 事件後、銅山側は全従業員をいったん解雇し、身元の明らかなものだけを再雇用した。
sen.e: After the riot, the operator of the mine once fired every worker, and rehired only workers who could be identified.
After the riot, the operator of the mine once fired every worker, and rehired only those who could be identified.
sen.cmt: workers を those に修正しました。
sen.e: After the riot, the operator of the mine once fired every worker, and rehired only those who could be identified.

sen.j: これにより、至誠会は解体されたが、銅山側は2割の賃金アップをのみ、また、施設の被害も甚大だったことから、この騒動では銅山側も大きな利益はなかったとみられる。
sen.e: This dissolved Shiseikai, but the operator of the mine accepted to raise the wage by 20 %, and as the damage of the facilities was extensive, the operator of the mine didn't gain much benefits from this riot.

This dissolved Shiseikai, but the operator of the mine accepted to raise the wage by 20 %, and as the damage of the facilities was extensive, the operator didn't gain much benefits from this riot, either.
sen.cmt: 後半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: This dissolved Shiseikai, but the operator of the mine accepted to raise the wage by 20 %, and as the damage of the facilities was extensive, the operator didn't gain much benefits from this riot, either.

sen.j: 裁判では検察側は至誠会が暴動を示唆したと主張したが、この主張は認められず、南助松と永岡鶴蔵には無罪の判決がおりた。
sen.e: At the trial, prosecutors claimed Shiseikai for solicitation of the riot, but this claim was rejected, and both Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were sentenced innocent.
At the trial, prosecutors claimed Shiseikai for solicitation of the riot, but this claim was rejected, and both Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were sentenced innocent.
At the trial, prosecutors claimed Shiseikai for solicitation of the riot, but this claim was rejected, and both Sukematsu MINAMI and Tsuruzo NAGAOKA were sentenced innocent.

sen.j: 後の二村一夫の研究では、直接のきっかけは飯場頭が労働者側を挑発したという説が有力になっている。
sen.e: In the later research by Kazuo Nimura, a popular theory is that a head of hanba (accommodation for mine workers) provoked workers, and this was the direct opener.
In the later research by Kazuo NIMURA, a popular theory is that a head of hanba (accommodation for mine workers) provoked workers, and this was the direct opener.
sen.cmt: Numira を NIMURA に修正しました。
sen.e: In the later research by Kazuo NIMURA, a popular theory is that a head of hanba (accommodation for mine workers) provoked workers, and this was the direct opener.

sen.j: 足尾暴動後、栃木県警察は足尾分署を足尾警察署に昇格させた。
sen.e: After the Ashio Riot, Tochigi Prefectural Police Department promoted Ashio Branch Police Station to Ashio Police Station.
After the Ashio Riot, Tochigi Prefectural Police Department promoted Ashio Branch Police Station to Ashio Police Station.
After the Ashio Riot, Tochigi Prefectural Police Department promoted Ashio Branch Police Station to Ashio Police Station.

sen.j: 同年6月には別子銅山でも暴動が起きているが、足尾暴動事件が飛び火したものといわれる。
sen.e: In June on the same year, a riot occurred in Besshi Copper Mine, and it is said to had been spilled over from Ashio Riot.
In June on the same year, a riot occurred in Besshi Copper Mine, and it is said to had been spilled over from Ashio Riot.
In June on the same year, a riot occurred in Besshi Copper Mine, and it is said to had been spilled over from Ashio Riot.
